sense.name: incite another to commit a crime
sense.examples: Enron suborned the market with criminal intent. He suborned perjury and tried to convince her to lie under oath. Mr. Clinton has suborned perjury and obstructed justice in this case. The prosecutor took the Fifth Amendment about suborning perjury. He could be guilty of suborning perjury. His father used threats to suborn Lady Hallim's adviser.

sense.name: obtain a false or perjured testimony
sense.examples: Suborn perjury by this woman, Jane Doe number five? He was asking your client -- he was suborning perjury.
